intro: Pourthiaea blinii, commonly known as the Blinii's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
